EasyJet says finance chief Findlay to leave in 2021 ...  2021 under the terms of his contract. His decision to quit comes as easyJet struggles with zero revenue since the coronavirus pandemic brought air travel to a halt in March, prompting the airline's founder Stelios Haji-Ioannou to call on management to cancel an order for new planes. Shareholders threw their weight behind management's strategy to stick with the Airbus order on Friday, supporting Findlay plus easyJet's chairman, chief executive and another director in a vote forced by Haji-Ioannou. Shares in easyJet, which had collapsed by over 60 percent since the coronavirus outbreak swept through Europe three months ago, jumped 18 percent in morning trade, which analysts said was on hopes that European summer holidays would soon restart.
